description.p: FFQueue is (yet another) graphical user interface for FFmpeg with comprehensive support for both the basic features but also the more advanced features like filtergraphs. FFQueue makes it easy to create multiple jobs and process them as a single queue.

ul.li: Run multiple jobs in parallel.
User extensible "Full Specification" support for codecs and presets.
Baked in "Full Specification" support for H.264, H.265 (HEVC) and more.
BUG-FIX: Some FullSpec checkbox fields defaulted to a wrong value (thanks to Mano).
Makefiles improved.

BUG FIX: With recent versions of FFmpeg all filters where grayed out / inacessible. You may need to delete any "ffmpeg-caps.*" file(s) from the config directory, found via the about box, for this fix to take effect (thanks to Mano).
Various, but minor, cosmetic fixes and modifications.
Added choice for "-err_detect" to preset (thanks to Jerome).
FullSpec strings with spaces not handled properly.
FullSpec checkboxes not always checked as expected.
Changed range of quantization (qmin, qmax) from 1..63 to 0..63.
Full Specification support for AV1 (libaom-av1, rav1e) added.
Quality settings for AV1 (libaom-av1, librav1e, libsvtav1) added.
Added "libopenh264" to CodecInfo.
Added button to edit CodecInfo from the Preset Editor.
Full Specification: Fields of type "check" may now be checked as default.
Full Specification: Added reset button to dialog.
wxWidgets updated to 3.2.8.
BUG FIX: File extension for stored FFmpeg capabilities was empty/borked for builds downloaded from ffmpeg.org.
BUG FIX: Full Specification: Having the "type" field before the "text" field, or augmenting a field without specifying "type", would reset type to "check".
